Major_Arcs.title: Arrival of Change in Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Nan and her dissatisfaction with Ghost Town, the arrival of men planning an airport, and the revelation of Ghost Town's impending demolition, setting the stage for conflict and change.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Lament and the Airport Plan
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her unhappiness in Ghost Town and her desire for a more exciting life, only to overhear news of its impending destruction for an airport.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Rejection and the Ghost Town Mystery
Cal's Frustrated Departure from Ghost Town
Arrival at Merrick Gulch and the 'Ghost Town' Label
Airport Development Plans for the Ghost Town
Nan's Distress and Realization of Ghost Town's Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal: Reconciliation and Airport Acceptance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan and Cal's evolving relationship in the face of Ghost Town's demolition. Nan apologizes to Cal, and they discuss the practicalities of the airport, leading to a form of reconciliation.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Practicality
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal navigate their feelings and differing views on romance and practicality, particularly concerning the new airport.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Apology and Practical View of the Airport
Nan's Reflection on Her Harsh Reaction to Cal
Cal's Cynical Monologue on Love and Ghost Town

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation and Family Advice
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Nan's confrontation with rough men, her argument with her father, and the comforting advice she receives from her mother and maid regarding love and relationships, setting up her pursuit of Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Conflict and Counsel
sub_scenes.description: Nan faces unwelcome advances from rough men, clashes with her father, and seeks solace and advice from family figures.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Rough Men and Nan's Resistance
Nan's Airport Frustration and Father's Dismissiveness
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Argument
Nan's Humiliation and Reflection in Bed
Mother's Advice on Love and Childishness
Father's Pragmatic Advice to Focus on Cal
Maid's Reassurance of Cal's Love and Need for Patience

Major_Arcs.title: Nan's Pursuit and Reunion with Cal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Nan's decision to understand her feelings for Cal, her pursuit of him, and their eventual emotional reunion amidst ranch duties and a time skip, culminating in a confession of love.

sub_scenes.title: Action and Confession
sub_scenes.description: Nan resolves to understand her feelings for Cal and actively seeks him out, leading to a reunion and heartfelt confessions.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Resolve to Know Cal's True Feelings
Horses Arriving and Ranch Hand's Request for Help
Argument with Father About a Deal

Major_Arcs.title: The Great Snowstorm and Community Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts the focus to a severe snowstorm impacting Ghost Town, creating a community crisis and testing relationships as resources dwindle and the airport becomes a lifeline.

sub_scenes.title: Weather's Impact and Community Response
sub_scenes.description: The community grapples with a devastating snowstorm, facing dwindling resources and mounting worries, while finding solace in communal support and the promise of aid.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Town Gossip
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and the town's mixed reactions to him, setting up a storyline focused on reputation, suspicion, and potential conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Town's Reaction to a Cowboy
sub_scenes.description: The town witnesses a confrontation involving Chane Benson and gossips about his dangerous reputation and actions.

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff, Sally, and the Shadow of Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers around Jeff's fascination with guns and Chane Benson, Sally's concern for Jeff, and the escalating conflict between Chane Benson and the town, driven by Clyde's articles.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Obsession and Sister's Fear
sub_scenes.description: Sally worries about Jeff's growing obsession with guns and his admiration for Chane Benson, fearing he is heading down a dangerous path.

narrative_arcs.title: Ominous Advice and Mention of Violence
Public Discussion about Chane Benson's Reputation and Article
Confrontation and Warning in the Office
Clyde's Determination to Publish Articles Despite Threats
Public Reaction to Clyde's Articles and Jeff's Insight
Considering a Dinner Invitation for Chane Benson
Awkward Dinner and Jeff's Demonstration for Chane

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner with Benson and Escalating Danger
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the dinner with Chane Benson, Sally's growing suspicion, and the escalating tension that leads to a violent confrontation and Jeff's injury.

sub_scenes.title: Suspicion and Violence
sub_scenes.description: A tense dinner leads to Sally's confrontation with Chane, a heated argument with Jeff, and a violent encounter where Jeff is injured and Clyde is threatened.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Accusation and Chane's Evasive Response
Escalating Accusations and Threat of Violence
Sally's Confrontation with Jeff about Betrayal
Sally's Outburst and Accusation of Manipulation
Realization of Danger and Urgent Action

Major_Arcs.title: Resolution of Benson Conflict and Newspaper's Stand
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Jeff's determined pursuit of Chane, the town's confrontation with Benson, and the eventual resolution where Benson is driven out, highlighting the newspaper's role in upholding justice.

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Jeff races to save Clyde, while townsfolk confront Benson, leading to Benson leaving town and a reflection on the newspaper's role.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with the Editor and Townsmen
Flashback to Clarion Office - The Ticking Clock
Flashback - Uncertainty and Fear Behind the Door
Reflection on Family, Courage, and Decency in Journalism

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Betsy and Steve: Ranch Conflict Begins
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Betsy and Steve, setting up a new western romance and conflict centered around ranch troubles and rivalries.

sub_scenes.title: New Ranch Hand and Ominous Signs
sub_scenes.description: A physical confrontation hints at underlying ranch tensions as Steve Daley is introduced as the new ranch hand for Betsy, amidst signs of trouble.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy
Confirmation of Hiring and Foreshadowing Trouble

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles and Rising Suspicion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the ranch's problems, Betsy's growing suspicion of Steve, and their journey to town where conflict with Fred Bridges escalates into a physical fight.

sub_scenes.title: Distrust and Town Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Hank discuss Steve, revealing ranch troubles. Betsy remains suspicious of Steve as they head to town, where they face Fred Bridges.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Steve's Character and Past
Journey to Town and Lingering Doubts
Leaving the Store and Betsy's Sarcasm
Aftermath of the Punch and Further Threat
Discussion on Gunfighters and Hornets' Nest

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Decision and Romantic Resolution with Steve
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Betsy grappling with her feelings for Steve, deciding to keep him but under her terms, and ultimately resolving their differences with a romantic confession and acceptance.

sub_scenes.title: Gunslinger or Lover?
sub_scenes.description: Betsy reflects on Steve's gunfighting skills, decides to keep him but without the guns, and ultimately falls in love, leading to a romantic resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Understanding and Betsy's Romantic Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Escalating Ranch Conflict and Betsy's Resolve
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc sees the ranch conflict escalate with Old Man Bridges' demands, Betsy and Steve's confrontation with him, and Betsy's decision to take a stand against gun violence, culminating in a journey to Devil's Pass.

sub_scenes.title: Stand-off at Double K Ranch
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges arrives, demanding the ranch, leading to confrontations and Betsy's firm stance against violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Accusation
Betsy and Steve's Confrontation and Steve's Challenge to Hank
Betsy's Stand Against Gun Violence and Concern for Steve
Steve's Reflection on Past Mistakes and the Ambush
Betsy and Steve's Parting and Betsy's Worried Reflection
Betsy's Command and Ride to Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass and Romantic Climax
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc culminates at Devil's Pass, revealing its grim history and leading to Betsy's emotional and romantic reunion with Steve, resolving their immediate conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Resolution at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: At Devil's Pass, Betsy and Steve resolve their conflict and declare their love amidst the backdrop of a historically significant location.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Ominous Recognition
Betsy's Recovery and Reassurance by Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred: Range War and Romantic Triangle Begins
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Carrie, Dave, and Fred, setting up a new range war conflict and a complex romantic triangle, beginning with a protective argument and escalating range disputes.

sub_scenes.title: Protective Argument and Range War
sub_scenes.description: Carrie argues to protect Dave, as range war tensions escalate with the arrival of Curley and news of Bar 'C' ranchers encroaching.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Arrival and Range Conflict
Explaining the Fence and Herd Concerns
Fred Gordon's Polite but Tense Arrival

Major_Arcs.title: Flashback to Carrie and Fred's Past Romance and Present Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc alternates between flashbacks of Carrie and Fred's romantic past and the escalating present conflict, revealing Carrie's conflicted feelings and the re-emergence of Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Past and Present Entanglements
sub_scenes.description: Flashbacks reveal Carrie's past with Fred, while present day confrontations reveal her conflicted feelings and the re-emergence of Fred Gordon.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings about Fred
Present Confrontation: Fred Gordon and Carrie
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Attempt to Reconcile

Major_Arcs.title: Carlton Contract Deception and Carrie's Stand
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc exposes Fred's deceitful motivations behind his proposal, Carrie's angry reaction, and her determined confrontation with Mr. Carlton to secure her ranch's future.

sub_scenes.title: Unmasking Fred's Deception
sub_scenes.description: Fred's true, contract-driven motivations are revealed, leading to Carrie's anger and decision to confront Mr. Carlton.

Major_Arcs.title: Triumph at Carlton's Office and Father's Comfort
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie's successful confrontation with Mr. Carlton, securing her ranch's future, and her emotional resolution with her father, receiving comfort and validation.

sub_scenes.title: Victory and Consolation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Carlton and secures her ranch, then seeks comfort from her father after the emotional ordeal.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom on Love and Life

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie's Confession and Reunion with Fred
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc sees Carrie reflecting on Fred, encountering Dave again, confessing her love for Fred, and finally reuniting with Fred in a romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Reunion and Confession
sub_scenes.description: Carrie reflects on Fred, encounters Dave, confesses her love, and rides to Fred, leading to their romantic reunion.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Relief and Reflection on Fred
Mr. Carlton's Arrival and Carrie's Misinterpretation
Revelation of Fred's Sacrifice and Brother's Intervention
Carrie's Emotional Awakening and Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Dirk and Marshal Cready: New Conflict Begins
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new storyline with Dirk and Marshal Cready, shifting to a pursuit narrative and setting up a fresh conflict involving law and order.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Return and Injury
sub_scenes.description: Dirk returns injured, prompting concern and setting up a new conflict involving the law.

Major_Arcs.title: Marshal's Pursuit and Compromise
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Marshal Cready's pursuit of Dirk, his arrival at the ranch, and a negotiated compromise for Dirk's temporary safety due to his injury.

sub_scenes.title: Law Arrives at the Ranch
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Cready arrives pursuing Dirk, leading to a confrontation and a compromise for Dirk's temporary safety.

narrative_arcs.title: Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Inquiry
Confirmation of Pursuit and Denial of Dirk's Presence
Rance Cready's Insistence and Proof of Dirk's Presence
Concern for Injured Dirk and Assertion of Law

Major_Arcs.title: Chris and Rance's Reunion and Confession of Love
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the emotional reunion of Chris and Rance, their confessions of love, and the complex situation involving Dirk's escape and Rance's duty.

sub_scenes.title: Reunion and Love's Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance reunite amidst the Dirk situation, leading to heartfelt confessions of love and complex emotional and ethical dilemmas.

narrative_arcs.title: Rejection of Excuse and Acknowledgment of Change
Argument, Confession and Confirmation of Love
Rance's Internal Conflict and Realization of Misjudgment
Rance's Decision, Departure Announcement and Realization of Manipulation

Major_Arcs.title: Pursuit, Confrontation, and Resolution of Dirk's Story
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the dramatic pursuit of Dirk, the confrontation with the Marshal, the ensuing violence, and the resolution of Dirk's storyline through escape and a final romantic resolution for Chris and Rance.

sub_scenes.title: Violent Escape and Final Vows
sub_scenes.description: Dirk attempts escape, leading to a violent confrontation with the Marshal, followed by Chris and Rance's final romantic resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern about the Marshal and Reassurance
Realization of Pursuit and Urgent Escape
Argument on Handling the Injured Person
Forced Departure and Concern for the Injured
Woman's Reflection and Understanding of Love for Rance
Return to Rance and Confrontation about Injury
Father's Departure and Hint at Private Matters
Expression of Gratitude and Love Confession
Rance's Reflections on Marriage and Dirk
